problems.title: K-th Symbol in Grammar (Recursive)
problems.description:
We build a table of rows where row 1 is '0'. To build the next row, replace each '0' with '01' and each '1' with '10'. Given N and K (1-based), find the K-th symbol in row N using recursion.

Input Format:
Two integers N and K separated by space.

Output Format:
Print 0 or 1, the K-th symbol.
hintsList: Observe recurrence: symbol at (n,k) depends on parent at (n-1, (k+1)/2) and whether k is odd or even (flip or keep).
